WRITING.TEXT: I've been reading this sub for so long, and never posted, but this made me want to finally jump on and tell my story. I met this girl my last year of law school, and just fell hard for her. For a reason I can't explain, I proposed to her three months after meeting her, about a month before graduation. I should have known that something was up when she kept blowing up and giving me the ring back, saying that "she's not good enough for me." Looking back now, there were so many signs of borderline personality disorder. She was also a Type 1 diabetic with an insulin pump. It was Memorial Day weekend 2008, so it's been 6 years almost to the day. We went out to this bar because one of her friends was moving away. I offered to be the designated driver, since it was her friend, even though she's not supposed to drink with an insulin pump. So she's drinking and drinking, and finally I get her to leave. We're driving in my car back to her place, and she starts arguing with me in the car. Then out of nowhere, she starts punching me in my face while I'm driving, giving me a bloody nose. I tell her that's it, I'm done, and finally arrive at her apartment, drop her off, and drive home. About 5 minutes after arriving at my home, I hear the doorbell. I go to the door, and it's the ex-fiance', saying "I dropped my phone in your car. Give it back to me now." I tell her that I'm not in the mood for doing any favors for her, and that I will drive by the next morning to drop it off. She then pushes her way past me into my apartment, and says she's not leaving until I give her phone back. I tell her again, to please leave, because she had just given me a bloody nose while driving her. She responds to this by punching me repeatedly in my face, closed fist, to the point that she knocks my contact lenses out of my eyes. I retreat back to my bedroom and sit down at my desk, hoping that perhaps if I'm in a sitting position, it may stop the violence. She follows me into my bedroom, and starts throwing things off my shelf. She goes to my nightstand, pulls the drawer out, dumps the contents on the floor, then throws the drawer at my head, where it cuts my head open, and I begin to bleed profusely. At this point, I lose it emotionally, and start bawling, telling her "I don't understand what I have done to you to make you do this to me." She then gets up, walks out of my bedroom and to my kitchen. I begin thinking "okay, maybe the sight of all that blood has made her finally realize what she's done." NOPE! She grabs a large kitchen knife from the kitchen, first walks to my living room wall, and starts stabbing the wall with the kitchen knife, saying "There goes your security deposit!" She then walks right up to me with it, and starts swinging it back and forth with it, slicing my leg in the process. She finally throws it off to the side, and I go to grab my cell phone to call the police. Well, I had one of those flip phones, since it was 2008, so as I'm trying to call the police, she grabs it, and breaks it in half. She then sits down on my bed and says: "If you want me gone, all you have to do is give me my cell phone back." So I starting crawling on the ground of my bedroom, trying to feel for my car keys, because I'm legally blind without my contacts, so I can't see them. I finally find the car keys, walk to the car, open it, and yes, her cell phone was under the passenger seat. I hand it to her, she takes it, doesn't say a word, and then drives off. At this point I collapse, and the next morning when I wake up, I drive to a friend, use their phone to call the police, and meet the officer back at my apartment. The officer is sitting in his car, not wanting to be there. I start telling him the story, then I stop and say "you might want to come inside and see it for yourself." He comes along, walks inside, and the first thing he says when he sees the dried blood all over the place is "don't move anything, don't touch anything, this is a crime scene." She was arrested, and the police captain asks me: "you have two choices: 1) you can throw the book at her, because she's committed several felonies, and she'll spend the night in jail, or 2) you can just teach her a lesson, charge her with a misdemeanor, and she'll be released later today. I go with option 2, and she wound up without any criminal conviction. Within the next 30 days, I move to NYC, about 2.5 hours away. And the most messed up thing? I invite her to come down and spend a night with me. But I haven't had contact with her since the end of 2008, I'm now happily married to someone much more sane, but I always take allegations by my clients of domestic violence by women very seriously because of my experiences. tl;dr: borderline personality ex-fiance' goes all Friday the 13th on me, which isn't enough to stop me from sleeping with her.

I was waiting for the Washington DC metro, wearing my green IDF shirt. IDF being short for Israeli Defense Forces. I had recently returned from a trip to Israel and wanted to show off the fact that I had a shirt with Hebrew on it. So I'm waiting there and this guy in his mid 20s comes up to me and says "So you like killing babies?" Well, yes, but that's none of his business. I look at him confused and he continues "you support killing babies. You zionist asshole." And then proceeds to spit on me. I say "ok obviously you're dealing with a lot of problems in your life, so I'm sorry about that, but spitting just seems a bit crude." He tells me that Israelis killing babies is his problem, and spits on me again. The train arrives at that point, I turn to board the train, and he then spits on me a third time on my back. Tl:dr : I wear an IDF t-shirt, kid flips out and literally lets loose a fury of spit.

A lot of these may be repeats but here is what came to mind reading through this thread: 1) Learn how to be independent. Learn how to do your own laundry, cook, clean, and be responsible for everything in your life. My sister is 30 (I'm 33) and she never learned how to do that. She still lives at home with my parents, who clearly are enabling her dependence. 2) Financial prioritizing is important to learn, but most likely you won't until you are the only source of income to pay all your bills. When it's coming close to the end of the month, and rent is due, you should think twice about buying a new game, cigarettes, alcohol, or anything that isn't vital to keep you alive. 3) Sometimes the best way to learn how to truly be an adult, and a better person, is to hit rock bottom. 4) You never really "feel" like an adult until you have a conversation with someone much younger, and realize that you have nothing in common. When I was in my late 20's I remember dating girls right out of college and having nothing in common or to talk about. I only become aware of how old I am when I see or hear kids in their late teens or early 20s, and realize that they are a generation away. 5) Don't rush into marriage or think that you have to start a family immediately after college. Don't let the fact that many of your friends from high school are getting married and having gets pressure you into just settling or winding up with someone that you really shouldn't be with. I luckily have never had to go through a divorce, but, I'm a divorce attorney, and it's scary how many divorces I'm performing for people in their mid 20's. Just remember that it's significantly easier and cheaper to get married than it is to get divorced. And if you have a kid with this person? You're going to have to deal with this person that you now hate until your child is 18. 6) And finally, for those of you off to college in the fall, here is a bit of conflicting advice: enjoy yourself, but don't major in partying. Cherish the last few years of your life without significant responsibilities. But while you're in college, take advantage of the fact that you will never again have the opportunities to learn so much about everything. Don't just take your "required" classes or what you need to graduate. Go through the course book each semester, and highlight classes that actually sound interesting to you. And guess what: if the majority of classes that sound really interesting to you are not in your major, maybe you just discovered what you are really into.

Hello, my name is Seth, and I'm a recovering Warcrack addict. I have spent more than 140 days of my life just playing my main character (180 x 24 hours = 4,320 hours of my life), and more than half of that time playing alts. I am admittedly farther behind in my career than I would have been if I had not spent so much of my life playing this game. I have not played this game since 2011, and every day I look back and wonder what my life would have been like if I had not spent so much of it playing this game for so many years.

Cats. I grew up with two dogs and was essentially brainwashed by my mother to believe cats are terrible pets. Then my girlfriend at the time while I was in law school adopted a cat. I fell in love. Ten years after that realization that cats are awesome, my wife and I now have four cats in a one bedroom apartment in Manhattan. So many kittehs all up in here.

Other men who have ruined it for the rest of us. For example, I'm a fast walker. So if I'm booking it and come up behind a woman she will instinctively grab her pocketbook and take a defensive stance. I'm not going to rape you, I'm just to get around you because you walk too slow. But because of all the gropers and rapists, and fast walking guy is presumed to be attempting a sexual assault.

I'm a child support attorney in Manhattan. I often get clients who ask me how they can avoid paying for child support. So I tell them I have a secret that most people don't know : all they have to do to avoid paying child support is to go home, invent a time machine, go back in time and not have unprotected sex with the woman. They usually respond with a look of crushed hopes.

Adderall and a wife. I went from an out of work attorney who had become complacent just bartending for two years to running my own successful family law firm in New York city. The only difference was the addition of Adderall and a wife to support.
This. We live in a one bedroom apartment in Manhattan. We plan on having kids. I hope they don't mind begging on the subway when they're old enough.

More than two years now, can count on my hands the number of comments I've posted, and I check Reddit like I'm praying to Mecca. First thing in the morning, one of the last things at night, with three times in between.

I have determined that all Long Island and Westchester do is breed college students and send them away. I went to University of Maryland, and the entire Greek community was just transplanted New Yorkers.

My most interesting case had nothing to do with my client hating his spouse, and just about him being a bit psycho. Negotiated a pretty good settlement for my client, an out of work sixty something husband who was just a terrible person. Opposing counsel who represented wife agreed to do all the paperwork post inquest. First sign something was wrong with my client is he was emailing me while Hurricane Sandy was hitting NYC how he wanted me to file an order to show cause because his wife did not make a bank transfer that day. I pretty much told him that there were bigger things going on around us at the moment. Fast forward a few months, still no paperwork submitted by counsel, I receive two letters by courier, one to me and one addressed for my wife. My client writes that he has hired an executor to kill me and my wife if the divorce isn't finished in sixty days. Can't hate him too much because he also wrote that our cats would be okay. Guy can't be found by the police who cared for a week and then stopped. This past winter he sends an email asking for me to get his winter coat from his wife. I ask him why I would do that after he threatened to kill me and my wife. He says be he's cold. Tl;dr: crazy client threatens to kill me and my wife but protect my cats, later asks me to get a winter coat for him.
I have a pending custody case where I'm representing the mother, and the court appointed an attorney for the child. The child turned one in February. About as close to a baby lawyer as you can get.

Some of the most memorable years of my life were spent playing WoW. Attorneylaw, MT and GM of Bellum Gero on Hyjal. I met so many people who I'm still Facebook friends with even though I pretty much stopped playing around winter 2011. Ironically, I only met my wife because the Hyjal servers were down one evening in August of 2011. Many people talk about the hours and years of my life wasted playing this game, and I have avoided every temptation to rejoin, but I have no regrets over the amazing people and raids I experienced in WoW.
New York. The Empire State. The rest of you are just rebel scum.

There are times, days, nights, even now having spent my day nonstop for 14 hours on being a lawyer that I have asked myself: "Wouldn't you be happier being a bartender again?" Admission - I was admitted to practice in January 2008, spent a good deal of post-crash employment as a full time bartender. And although I never had any wishes, desires, or even the slightest urge to be a Family Law attorney, some days I get clients who come to tears, give me a hug, and tell me that I was awesome, and then it all becomes worthwhile. So my best answer is this: become a lawyer if you are doing so not just for the money, but because you can go home at the end of the night and say "I did something positive with my life today."
Pssh. Diggah please!

Child custody dispute where no state had exclusive jurisdiction. Child was born in New York, had spent about 200 days in New York, non consecutive, 100 days in Florida, mostly consecutive, mother in New York and father in Florida. Father gets a Florida judge to award immediate custody, child taken from mother's arms by nypd. I filed motion in New York to gain jurisdiction but the New York judge didn't want the case. But Florida judge then declined jurisdiction, case sent to New York. Was quite the drain on me emotionally and time wise just to get a custody case in New York.

Been a solo family law and Matrimonial attorney for five years now in NYC. I have to deal with so much emotion and unbridled feelings for 12 hours a day (I have a home office which doesn't help), that by the time my wife gets home around 8 PM there are only two things I want to do : drink a third of a bottle of scotch and play computer games. It's so hard to actually listen to my wife about her day because all I've listened to throughout the day is how terrible the other parent is. I imagine that family therapists or psychologists don't have anywhere the level of alcoholism and broken marriages, because when the hour is up with the client, that's all until next week.

I have, but I was the one who was abusing it. It became a real issue in our marriage because of the abuse. Initially I was taking 2 30mg tabs a day. Started to take extra when needed. So she confronted me about it saying it has to stop. I started seeing a different psychiatrist who switched me over to the XR, which helped. The only downside was that my Rx was upped to 3 30mg of XR a day, all in the morning. But you know what helped more than anything else? I gave my pills to my wife. That's right. When I filled a Rx, I would give it to her immediately. She would then give me one day's Rx at a time so there was no chance to abuse it. She kept it locked up as well in her saxophone case which had a numeric lock to it, making it impossible for me to break in. Well, fast forward to 6 months later, and I am now 25 days straight without any Adderall. I started seeing a new psychiatrist who switched me over immediately to straterra. And now here I am, on 0 mg of adderall after being at 90mg a day at one point. And my wife couldn't be happier.

I took 90mg a day for 3 years. Went quasi cold turkey. New psychiatrist stopped all Adderall and replaced it with straterra. I'm now 4.5 months with no Adderall.

Here's the thing - if you're going from a high does of Adderall, like I did, to no amphetamines at all, there's going to be a couple of hard days. I remember that I was pretty worried about how it would affect me during the week, as I went from 90mg of Adderall on Monday to 0 mg of Adderall on Tuesday, but 80mg of Straterra. I won't lie: Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday were some very hard days to get through, but my Monday the following week, I hardly felt any withdrawal symptoms. As a side note: straterra had some bad heart burn side effects for me. And alcohol just exacerbated the heart burn. So within 30 days going off of the Adderall, I quit drinking as well. It's amazing how much more energy you have when you get a good night's sleep.

I did not have the same level of withdrawal symptoms as when I had previously gone a day or two without any Adderall. I still felt a bit down, and overall sluggish, but nothing like how it felt to go cold turkey in the past.

When a client called me this past memorial day and I asked why she was calling me on a holiday, she replied that she didn't think Jews celebrated Memorial day. Never thought that I would have to explain that to anyone. Edit : to answer some of the questions, yes I am Jewish, no I never told her I was Jewish. I have an answering service which took her call and emailed me the message which was that it was very urgent that she speak with me that day. Given that the courts were closed and her case was a paternity and child support matter, I thought it had to be quite the emergency. It was not. She just wanted to ask whether the suspected father was required to take the DNA test ordered by the court. I then had to explain what paternity meant.
I am Jewish, but never told her I was Jewish. Although, to her credit, there is a mezuzah on the doorway to my office.

I have an answering service which was turned on, but I get emails sent when a message is left. The message left was that it was urgent that she speak with me that day about her case (paternity and child support). So I called her back with the assumption that it was an emergency. It was not, and certainly could have waited until the next day.
She said that she had a Jewish friend who didn't do anything on Memorial day so it was her understanding that Jews don't celebrate Memorial day.

Well, I was already retained to represent her and had already appeared in court on her behalf on several occasions. I politely corrected her and represented her for 2 months when she fired me because I told her that I was taking my first one week vacation since my honeymoon in July 2013 and therefore would not be reachable for that week. It was a welcome relief.

To my credit.... The message left with my answering service was that it was a matter of urgency that she speak to me. It was not urgent. She had a couple of questions to ask me which could have waited one day.

Meanwhile, when NYC schools are closed for Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippor, everyone forgets that they are important holidays, and assume I'll be available to meet or call. But if it makes you feel better, I've had a number of clients who guessed that I was Greek or Jewish.

Sigh... So I'm a family law attorney. Although I bill hourly for divorce representation, I only charge by the appearance for family court. Which means she didn't have to pay me for the phone call. Why do I do this? Well, here in NYC there's a large number of people who make too much to qualify for a free lawyer (as they would on a child custody matter) but too little to afford an expensive $500 per hour attorney. Because of how I charge, it's much more affordable for these people to afford my services and have legal representation when they otherwise wouldn't. But I will admit that clients like this make me seriously reconsider my business model.

Except I'm fairly certain she would think I was serious. By the way, this same client had previously called to ask me which court appearance she should go to. I asked her what other court appearance she had besides the one she had retained me for. She said she had a criminal court appearance. I asked her why. She stated because she had destroyed the suspected father's BMW with a bat because he stopped paying her child support. I explained that it was probably more important that she appear in her criminal court case and asked her politely to not destroy the property of the party who we were taking to court for paternity and child support.

I'm curious about why some people rank mastery above versatility and others the reverse. I understand the general mechanics and that for physical damage fights mastery is superior and versatility for magic damage. But is there one that, on average, is better than the other? For example, if I don't want to keep switching gems and enchants depending on an encounter, which is simply more utilitarian? I would imagine it's versatility as it mitigates all damage as well as makes healing more effective but I'm open to arguments stating otherwise.

Any recommendations on what abilities to macro together? Honestly, my biggest obstacle at the moment is setting up key bindings to easily and quickly use my abilities. And I find that I often neglect to include focus rage in my rotation.

WRITING.TITLE: What class has blizzard improved the most since start of Cata? The worst?
WRITING.TEXT: Quick background, started playing vanilla about 8 months before BC came out. Played all BC, became a GM and raid leader on my warrior tank, running 2 25 mans. Met my wife two months after Cata comes out, stop playing until this past October, now have 3 110s ~865: protection warrior, BM hunter, enhance shaman. Have my 85 lock and 80 DK. I'm wondering how everyone feels regarding class changes, if we look at the class at the start of Cata and then again now with 7.1.5 approaching. I've been mostly satisfied with the improvements for protection warriors, having more aoe options than tab devastate. Seems much easier to master than before. Demo lock seems to be significantly more boring to play and it's why I haven't leveled further. Loving enhance shaman, significantly more than the beginning of Cata. Very happy with what they did. BM hunter I'm mixed. I love the mobility improvements as well as the hunter pet synergy, but I feel that they've made the class a 4 button play. Curious as to what others have to say regarding improvements or lack there of since the start of Cata.

I've looked around but have had difficulty locating trinket guides for enhance. Anyone have a good link? I'm using shock rod and tiny jar of ooze as both have nature damage that scales with mastery but I'm curious how other trinkets stack up against each other.

Maybe it's just the market I'm in (NYC), but these days people don't really advertise with a business card, they do it through online advertising. 90% of the business cards I hand out are to opposing counsel, and yes I'm a family law attorney. But it's not like attorneys are hanging out around courthouses just waiting to give their business cards out to prospective clients.

Dwarf warrior. Because Gimli. Incidentally, he's still technically my main after all these years, but recently I've been a bit of a traitor to the dwarves by spending most of my time on my night elf Hunter.

Unfortunately, since 7.1.5 I've been having real trouble with my rotation, prioritizing and just putting out the numbers I should be putting out with my gear. I don't have any tier pieces but I do have the legendary helmet, belt and boots. I've been running the helm and boots most of the time. Should I only take hot hands with a tier bonus? And what about tempest? When does lightning bolt prioritize over lava lash? I've been playing around with different weak aura set ups but having difficulty keeping track of when I'm 60+ maelstrom.

I had mixed opinions of the prequel. Abilities were good, the space added some new elements, the claptrap dl was pretty stellar, and I can't get enough Jack. But overall, the gameplay was way too linear and too cumbersome to farm bosses or to have much replay value. Borderlands 1, if played after borderlands 2, just seems too ancient and needs a bit of a graphics reboot. Borderlands 2 stands alone as one of the few single player games that I can play over and over again just like Fallout 3 or New Vegas. The only thing I would change is to bring some more balance to the legendaries and classes (I feel like I'm in /wow when I write this). The first class I played was Sal which made the other classes 2nd rate when compared to Gunzerker with the DPH and Grozzle. It made OP 8 pretty easy.

WRITING.TITLE: An apology to two Pugs.
WRITING.TEXT: So I want to apologize to two separate groups last night. First to the group that accompanied my hunter Attorneyhunt on a depleted CoS +13 run. My DPS was subpar and as one of you pointed out, I shouldn't be doing mythic + with 15 fps. Although to be fair I'm usually between 30 to 40 fps and that's with graphics at 1. I would consider myself the type of person that mythic + was designed for. Back in the day, I was a hard core raider and raid leader for almost all of Wrath. I stopped halfway through Cata because real life demands became too much to keep to any sort of raiding schedule. I didn't come back again until the end of October. I very rarely have more than a consecutive hour free at any given time. But I like challenging myself and I really look forward to the weekly chest. So I have enough time to run mythic +, and finally hit KSM two days ago. My guild is made up of 7 of my close friends. Only one of them plays consistently throughout the week. As an example, Monday nights are our guild run nights. And last night two of my friends had to go check their weekly chest because they had not been on since Monday last week. Mythic + offers constant evolving challenges with the chance and opportunity to still gear up close to 900. If this didn't exist, if it was just heroics and raids there wouldn't be much of a reason for me to play. On a similar note, I'm also glad that LFR exists, because how else would I be able to see Guldan? And how else would I have the opportunity to raid with less than an hour available and the chance for set pieces?

WRITING.TITLE: Is it dishonest to link to an achievement from an alt? Would you kick a player for doing so?
WRITING.TEXT: So last week I finally got my KSM on my hunter. I currently play 4 toons, a protection warrior, an enhancement shaman, my BM hunter and havoc DH. All 4 toons are between 888 and 902. As many of you know, a lot of group leaders ask to link your KSM for an invite for a higher level mythic. But I noticed that when I link to the KSM on a toon other than my hunter, the tool tip still says that the achievement was accomplished by the toon that linked it. Recently, I linked the achievement from my tank, who had not actually accomplished the KSM himself. I was invited to the group. And after everyone had been summoned I was removed from the group. I whispered the leader who said that I had not actually accomplished the achievement according to my armory. So, thoughts? Does the ability to accomplish KSM on one toon hold any weight for skill on other toons? Would you remove a player if they had done what I did?

I can thank these downtimes for helping me meet my wife. Story : I was a guild leader and raid leader through all of WOTLK. Around mid August 2010 there was evening server maintenance for one reason or another. So, I figure I might as well take a look at the online dating pool, specifically jdate. This girl sends me a message, we're chatting and then go to the phone for the next 3 hours. Arrange a date for 2 days later. First date is 7.5 hours long. I move in 3 months later. My raiding substantially decreases, leave the game about halfway through Cata. Get married November 3, 2012. My close friend said Legion has been sounding good back in October, I rejoin. Now, I play until my wife gets home. The moral of the story is server downtime can help get you married.

Wow I think you're the first person from Hyjal I've seen on reddit. I've been on Hyjal since Vanilla. Horde or Alliance? I'm happy to run some mythic + with you. My guild is made up entirely by my close friends, with 6 of us total, 3 of whom only play 1 night a week. But being in a guild or not being in a guild shouldn't affect your ability to run +. Since 7.2 there are a lot more mythic + options which you can be carried. Just get your keystone and you'll get a group. Just as an example, yesterday I started off with a DHT 3. Formed a group on my own as a dps and advertised it as an intention to keep pushing. Find 4 randos for the PUG and we obliterate it with a 3 chest. Key upgraded to NL 6. Ran with same group and we 3 chested again. Key upgraded to CoS 9. Lost our healer and tank, but quickly replaced them. 3 chested. Key upgraded to CoS 12. I needed a break but logged on again this morning and saw a carry group looking for 10+ cos keys. I signed up and we missed the 3 chest by 3 seconds but still comfortably got our 2 chest. That's 4 mythic + I was able to run without the help of any guildie. I will agree with you that the ilevel floor seems to have increased since 7.2 but just keep trying.

Here's the best way to get blood once you hit the isles and already have a toon at 110 revered with wardens : take the heirloom shoulders, add the blood shoulder enchant to it on the 110 then just mail the shoulders to the alt. I'm a child support lawyer in New York. I'm against and there's a good reason why. The custodial parent is not waiting for the child support check to pay rent. They're not waiting for the check to buy food. They are not waiting for it to buy clothes. Child support is in essence the non custodial parent reimbursing the custodial parent for money already spent on the child or children. To require accounting of how the money is spent completely ignores the reality of taking care of a child from day to day, week to week or month to month.

I'm a family court lawyer in NYC. I can't tell you how many times I have represented fathers who had custody but never sought child support, often times because of pride. And then, many years down the road, the child goes to live with the mother she immediately files to put the father on child support who then complains that he never put her on support and should be given credit for not doing so. Also, I want to point out that the law itself is gender neutral. Whomever has primary physical custody is the parent that can seek child support. It's just that the majority of the time it's the mother who has physical custody. And I believe this is because when the relationship ends, the father takes the view that he doesn't want to take the child away from their mother, so the father leaves and the child re with the mother. And then when he doesn't provide financial sup bev he buys things instead of provide money he's then surprised and angry that he's being taken to court for child support.

This really varies from state to state. There are some which will automatically order support as part of a custody proceeding. There are others, such as New York, where a parent has to take the affirmative step of filing for child support. And they have to take a separate step of opening an account with the child support collection unit if they want it garnished from a check.

So here are some things that I tell my clients (based on NY law): whether she earns $0 a year or $50k a year, the amount you pay stays the same. How the child support is spent, does not matter. You can have a video of the other parent taking your child support check, cashing it, and buying a bottle of champagne, and the court won't care. And why not? Because at the end of the day, the custodial parent is not waiting for your money to pay rent. They're not waiting for your money to buy food. They're not waiting for your money when they need to purchase clothes for the child, or supplies for the child, or any of the basic day to day necessities required to keep a child alive. And so the purpose of child support is not that the other parent take your money and then spend it on the child, but rather the view that both parents are financially responsible for raising a child, and you are in essence reimbursing the custodial parent for money that has already been spent on the child. And the fact that a parent would not ask for child support if they had custody doesn't change anything the court orders.

I have one huge complaint about messenger bags that eventually forced me to change to tumi professional backpacks. A messenger back strap will rub against whatever you are wearing underneath it since most of the weight and pressure is put on the one strap. So I had 3 suits that eventually were ruined because the material on my suit jacket front collars was rubbed down to an unrepairable point. I mentioned this issue when went to purchase my next suit and the salesman at Nordstroms was fantastically helpful and suggested that I switch to a backpack. Been doing it for the entire past year and so far no damage to my suits.

Judge Judy used to be a Judge in the same building I currently practice law : Manhatten family court. I'd say there is a growing trend to view parents as equals and not have a preference for the mother. What depresses me, however, is most fathers assume the system is against them, that they have no shot at full custody and then they never try. And there are plenty of people fathers who I see file for joint custody immediately after being ordered to pay child support, motivated solely by the desire to not pay support. But there are plenty of fathers I represent who are willing to fight to the end because they truly believe that it is in their child's best interest, regardless of whether their chances of succeeding are 1% or 99%.

WRITING.TEXT: \* \*\*Total budget and country of purchase:\*\* **$1k to $2k. USA.** \* \*\*Do you prefer a 2 in 1 form factor, good battery life or best specifications for the money? Pick or include any that apply.\*\* **This is a hard question to answer, because I'm unsure of to what extent I will be using this and how. I am a trial lawyer, and I already have a good Alienware desktop that I use for my gaming as well as my home office work. But...for most of the day I'm not in my home office as I tend to spend most of the day at court with use of the attorney lounge in between court appearances.** **I already have a feeling that I'm going to need a screen larger than 13". My eyesight is bad, and I've found myself squinting when using a 13" laptop. The one I used back in law school was 17", but that might be difficult to carry in a backpack easily.** **I also prefer to be able to have more than 1 window up at once. A lot of times I need to refer to e-mails or PDF while I'm typing in Word, so I need something to be able to fit a vertical split screen for work.** **I'm unsure as to whether or how I would get use out of the 2-1 at the moment. I could see myself taking it to the podium to lay down in front of me to read questions while in a trial setting, or quickly opening it to refer to my calendar or some quick notes, but I don't know how I would use it beyond that.** **In terms of gaming, I already use my home desktop for all my gaming, but since I'm an addict, I wouldn't mind something I could easily play WoW on if I have an hour break without much work to do.** \* \*\*How important is weight and thinness to you?\*\* **Probably the least important, to be honest. I used a monster 17" heavy Toshiba through all of law school, and I'm already used to carrying a large amount of weight on my back with all my files. So the difference to me for 5 to 7 lbs really won't change much.** \* \*\*Which OS do you require? Windows, Mac, Chrome OS, Linux.\*\* **Windows operating system .** \* \*\*Do you have a preferred screen size? If indifferent, put N/A.\*\* **See above - bad eyesight and the need to be able to multitask and multiwindow but still be able to fit it into a backpack.** \* \*\*Are you doing any CAD/video editing/photo editing/gaming? List which programs/games you desire to run.\*\* **I sometimes do PDF- gt;word and word- gt;pdf for office needs, but nothing major graphical. I probably won't use it for gaming beyond WoW.** \* \*\*If you're gaming, do you have certain games you want to play? At what settings and FPS do you want?\*\* **Well, I've gotten used to playing WoW at 80 FPS, but I wouldn't mind something that was 50 to 60 FPS for WoW.** \* \*\*Any specific requirements such as good keyboard, reliable build quality, touch-screen, finger-print reader, optical drive or good input devices (keyboard/touchpad)?\*\* **Would like a touch screen when needed. A good keyboard is a high requirement. Don't really care much about finger-print reader, optical drive, etc. And if I'm investing $1k to $2k, I would something reliable enough to last me at least 5 years.** \* \*\*Leave any finishing thoughts here that you may feel are necessary and beneficial to the discussion.\*\* **Before discovering this sub today, I had done a fair amount of research online, and found that there was a fair amount of overall consent on the Dell XPS 13, but less so for the 15 for some reason. I also saw good reviews for the Spectre 360. Started to customize an Alienware laptop before I decided to pause, and look to this sub before I purchased anything.** **Thanks in advance to everyone. I've read through a number of posts and I see there are a lot of knowledgeable helpful people in this sub.** Edit 1 - added USA as country.

WRITING.TITLE: S10+ trade in for s10 5G
WRITING.TEXT: So up until the s10+ I had never pre ordered a phone and used a phone until it became unusable. But, I was loving everything I saw for the s10+and was still using a s7 edge so I grabbed it. Now I received an email from Verizon about a pre-order for the s10 5G. I live in NYC at the moment which doesn't have a 5G roll out yet but I believe it will be in the near future. But down to the main question : is it worth it to trade in the s10+ for the s10 5G? I don't care too much about the camera, but I care about a superior computing device since I do a huge amount of my daily work and communications from my phone.

Had a divorce client, husband and father, who disowned his autistic son, tried to argue that he should get all of his wife's retirement having not worked for 12 years, contacted me during the height of hurricane Sandy (he was in the Bronx and me in Manhattan) saying he wanted to hold his wife in contempt for not paying him that day while the storm slammed NYC, told me I was making a huge mistake getting married (my wedding date was November 3rd, 4 days after Sandy) saying that I was going to be miserable and regret it.... I could go on. But, the worst was when, several months later, since his divorce was taking a long time, he sent death threat letters to myself and my wife saying that he had hired an "executor" to kill the two of us if his divorce wasn't finalized in 60 days. Called the police and they said he left his premises one day earlier. I heard nothing from him until February 2014 when he emailed me saying he needed a winter coat from his wife and could I help get it for him. Ironically, the divorce didn't have to be completed because he killed himself before the judge signed the judgment of divorce. tl;dr: Miserable guy who wanted to spread his misery, and crossed the line when he threatened to kill my wife. Edit : for something a little lighter, this Memorial day weekend reminds me of not my worst client, but definitely my dumbest. I was representing her on a child custody and child support matter. She was calling me on Memorial day saying she really needed to speak to me. I called her back and asked if it was urgent since it was Memorial day and all. She said: "oh, I didn't think that Jews celebrated Memorial day, so I thought you were going to be available." Edit 2: because so many people have pointed it out, I have now put the word executor in quotes because that was his word and not mine. Also, since people have questioned it, my user name is also the name of my firm.
I was still his lawyer but there were no further court appearances and I was simply waiting for the opposing counsel to complete the divorce packet to submit.

I told him that I wouldn't be able to perform any work for him during the week leading up to and the weekend including my wedding because I was getting married. So it was said more as a reason to him why he shouldn't expect any email responses from me during that week.
I am using his language, not mine. He literally said he was sending an executor to kill me and my wife.

I guess because I just assume, being a family law attorney, there are going to be some pretty erratic people, who focus the insanity with a legal dispute involving their ex and children towards their lawyer. But my wife has no reason to be the target of your misery nor is this what she signed up for when she married me.

I actually wrote back to him and asked if he remembered how only 8 months earlier he threatened to kill me and my wife and how could he possibly think that I was going to do him any favors. He wrote back that it was really cold out so he needed it.

Yes, although it wasn't worth it. Because, let's be honest, there really isn't any attorney fee that would have made going through that worth the money. Looking back now, since this was 6.5 years ago, I just think that my attenae to detect red flags wasn't totally developed yet.

I believe it was purposeful carbon monoxide poisoning. Ironically, his one positive quality was that he loved cats. He had a blog post a day or two before he killed himself where he said he was finally going to join his two cats who had passed away.

I should have put the word "executor" in quotes because this was the exact word he used. In the letter addressed to my wife he said that "because of your husband's incompetence, I have hired an executor to kill you and your husband unless he completes my divorce in 60 days." Never saw someone use the word executor like that, but who am I to question his use of words in a death threat letter?

He didn't even have any assets of his own because he didn't really work for 12 years leading up to the divorce. All of his assets were just going to be the assets he was going to be awarded as part of the divorce proceeding. The only way he was surviving is he took a portion of the 401k he was entitled to from his wife and asked that a reduced portion be paid as cash up front. These were some of the funds that he demanded his wife be held in contempt for not paying in the middle of hurricane Sandy.

Yeah but considering he was going to receive about $130k from her 401k as part of the divorce settlement, the funeral expenses more than outweighed what she was able to keep. By the way, I could never understand how this woman was married to this asshole. She was a genuinely sweet person who even baked cookies for her lawyer's office during the case.
To be fair.... He knew that my family had 4 cats, and in his death threat letters he promised that our cats were going to be taken care of and found a good home after we were killed.
I don't know... It was past the 60 days and really cold out so he may have actually thought that this was a perfectly normal and reasonable request to make to the lawyer he threatened to kill.

Well don't forget about prenups. I draft one about every 2.5 weeks these days. And about 75% of them agree to waive alimony in any divorce proceeding. Ironically, as a family law and divorce attorney, I did not sign a prenup with my wife, but I've consistently had soul crushing student loan debt that has made it difficult to actually acquire any assets.

Well 95% of the time angry spouses take out their aggression on their ex spouses and not their attorneys, but every so often we have an exception to the rule who blames their misery on their attorney.

I spent a lot of time during the divorce trying to calm him down and stop seeing his wife as an enemy. She was being very amicable with her settlement proposals and all he wanted to do was ruin her. Thankfully I was able to serve as a buffer and able to convince him to settle before he could ruin his wife's life any further. But yes, there were so many signs of depression, but nothing strong or visible enough to prevent him from knowingly and voluntarily entering into the divorce settlement. If I could have asked for a GAL to be assigned, I certainly would have.

I try as much as I can to be sympathetic to the emotions of my clients since family law and divorce are such emotional practice areas. But it was so hard to have any sympathy for him even before the death threat letters. When I found out that he killed himself it was a real sigh of relief for our family, and I really do hate to say it, but this was probably the best case scenario after everything he had done up to that point.

The thing is... A lot of family law clients believe that the only way I can understand what they are going through is if I too am married and have a child. Almost every single one of my child custody clients has asked if I have any children, thinking that the only way I can really represent them is if I too have children. It's a ridiculous presumption, but all of these people are going through a really emotional process and are looking for some reassurance that their lawyer is looking out for their interests.

As I responded to in another comment, I should have put executor in quotes, because those were his words, not mine. He specifically said to my wife that "because of your husband's incompetence, I have hired an executor to kill you and your husband unless he completes my divorce in 60 days."
Yes, based in Manhattan.

WRITING.TITLE: Legendaries need to be changed to Bind on Account.
WRITING.TEXT: Like many of you, I played a lot of Legion. And also like many of you, I play a lot of alts. To the point that I obtained all the legendaries available for all but 3 classes. And by the time you hit 120 they are all useless and can't be destroyed or sold so they just take up space in your bank. #8203; I hardly have long periods of consistent time, so I haven't been spending much time on raiding or mythics, and instead have been leveling allied races. Which means that at a certain point, I wind up leveling classes that I have already leveled to 120 and previously unlocked all the legendaries during Legion. For example, I leveled a Dark Iron shaman and had already obtained all the legendaries for my Draenei shaman. I am now leveling an Orc Death Knight for the Double Agent achievement and to start playing the allied races on Horde. I had previously leveled a Human Death Knight and obtained all the legendaries on him during Legion. #8203; Blizzard knows that we still have some interest in legendaries or they wouldn't have so many world quest rewards or mission table rewards that award essences for legendaries. And although legendaries only are usable from 101 to 116, it's still fun to use them for that period of leveling. #8203; So, why not change it so all legendaries are Bind on Account, so I can use legendaries on alts, instead of having them sit in all of my alt banks?

True, and honestly I could use any of my 120 alts to just blow through a bunch of world quests to get 1000 essences for the random loot box. But why? When I leveled my dark iron shaman I still had a bunch of essences on my 120s that I could spend on the random loot boxes but now that I'm leveling my second death knight, it just made me wonder why, if I had already obtained the legendary on my first death knight? As was said, it may be purposeful to have you spend more time to grind and stay subbed.... It just seems like there can be an easier system that would make it more fun to level alts for 15 levels that would do nothing to break the game.
/r/notmyjob

WRITING.TITLE: How do I find a financial advisor? Do I need a financial advisor?
WRITING.TEXT: Wife and I recently had a baby, now 9 months. Been reading about starting a 529 recently in this sub which I did over the weekend with fidelity. After a long long trek, I've gone from defaulting on $30k of student loans in 2009 to a 757 credit score and 0 credit card debt but still about $73k in student loans. I feel that my investing and future planning is all over the place. I've set up an Acorns account and Acorns later account which have about $1200 in it. I have a Qapital account with about $1k. I recently started a Wealth front account which has about $500 in it and I have the 529 account and general investing account with Fidelity. I live in NYC so a Google search for a financial advisor gets me nowhere but I'm also not sure how to find one and what to look for. Goals : 1) save enough to potentially purchase an apartment in the next 5 to 7 years in NYC. 2) save enough to pay for college for my daughter in 17 years. 3) pay off the remaining $70k of student loans. 4) start putting away more than $1k for retirement. I know these seem like lofty dream goals but for a long time my finances were so bad that my wife was an inch away from filing for divorce and this is the first time I feel in charge of my finances and with the potential to start looking at a future. I've never had more than 4 figures in a bank account until this year and now I have about $40k in my business bank account, which is ultimately my own income since I run a one man law firm. So now that I actually have assets I don't want to screw anything up. Thanks in advance to all.
Unfortunately my wife is self employed so neither of us have any retirement accounts through employment.
